intro: Diaperia prolifera var. barnebyi, commonly known as the Barneby's diaperia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually white to pale yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in the spring or early summer.
